boat.name: Harbinger
boat.full_description:
'Harbinger' is a Manx Nobby converted to a gaff cutter, she was built some time before 1917, when the last Nobby was built. She underwent a major rebuild between 1975-1985 in Shoreham when she was relaunched and then moved to the East Coast about the turn of the Millenium. A move to Chichester followed in 2007. Mike Sullivan has owned her since 2010 and keeps her in Southampton.

Harbinger's history before 1970 is unknown. Mike Sullivan has talked to Nobby owners on the Isle of Man and there never was a 'Harbinger' on the fishing Register, but when converted to a yacht there would almost certainly have been a change of name. The history we have starts in the mid 1970s with Eric Deeming's refit at Shoreham. A new deck and interior, recaulking of the hull and a new engine were the main changes then.

Since 2010, Harbinger has sailed up and down the English Channel from Douarnenez to the Ijselmeer and between Dover and Falmouth.  Not all in one year though!  

Now she needs a new custodian, so for more info or a trial sail, contact Mike on +4479 1059 7883.
boat.short_description: There is little known about the history of 'Harbinger' before 1970, though she was built before 1917, when the last Nobby was launched.

for_sales.sales_text:
`Harbinger’ is looking for a new custodian.  She is a gaff cutter yacht (originally a Manx Nobby fishing boat) now kept in Southampton, 38’6' LOD, 50’ LOA, 11"6" beam with a max draft 5"6".  The deck and interior date from a major refit in the late 1970s to mid 1980s.  Deck recaulked and new rudder made in 2017. 

During 2016 she sailed to Brest and Douarnenez and took part in both Maritime Festivals.  In 2017 she joined the Solent OGA cruise aimed at reaching the Scilly Isles and, along with most of the fleet, reached Falmouth, but got no further.

For partnership - Equal shares to a maximum of 3 partners
